This is a classic public goods game. If we both contribute optimally, we can maximize our mutual benefit. If I contribute X points and the other player contributes Y points, the pool becomes (X+Y)*1.6, and we each get (X+Y)*0.8. So I get (X+Y)*0.8 + (10-X) = 10 - X + 0.8*(X+Y) = 10 + 0.8*Y - 0.2*X. This means I benefit when the other player contributes more, and my contribution has a net cost to me but benefits both of us overall. Since we both want to maximize mutual benefit and this is stated as the priority, I should contribute significantly. I'll start with 7 points as a strong cooperative signal while keeping some points as insurance in case the other player doesn't reciprocate.
